page.title: 11ENTERPRISE ZONE
page.content: {Wellingborough}is a well-established market town. The market was established in 1201 when rights were granted by King John. Since the 1960's Wellingborough has become an expanding area with new industrial and commercial activities. Wellingborough Enterprise Zone is situated on the western side of the town. It covers 136 acres in total, of which 95 are developed. The Enterprise Zone has a mixture of nationwide firms such as Boots, Texas Homecare and the Anglia Building Society and local ones like Cosworth Engineering. To attract companies the following benefits are available:- {A)}Exemption from general rates. {B)}Exemption from land development tax. {C)}Tax allowances for buildings. {D)}Simplified planning procedures.
